DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study collect epidemiological data EGFR mutation status [ M+ ( mutation positive ) , M- ( mutation negative ) ] population predominantly Caucasian ethnicity , correlate EGFR mutation status clinico-pathological characteristic ( e.g . smoking status , sex , histology , etc ) . In particular , study aim determine frequency EGFR M+ lung cancer patient clinico-pathological characteristic commonly associate EGFR mutation positivity ( i.e. , smoker , men , non-adenocarcinoma ) .
DOC.brief_title: A Non-interventional Study ( NIS ) Registry Epidemiological Scientific Evaluation Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor ( EGFR ) Mutation Status Patients With Newly Diagnosed Locally Advanced Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung Cancer ( NSCLC ) ( Stage IIIB/IV Non-small Cell Lung Cancer ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Signed write informed consent . 2 . Female male age 18 year . 3 . Histologically confirm locally advanced metastatic NSCLC ( stage IIIB/IV ) . 4 . Patients receive 1stline treatment IIIB/IV NSCLC . 5 . Patients know EGFR mutation status ( i.e . patient must either EGFR M+ , EGFR M EGFR Mx ) . 6 . Tumour amenable curative surgery radiotherapy . 1 . Mixed histology small cell nonsmall cell lung cancer .
